topic.title: 15 ways to respect a left-handed person.
topic.body:
I recently listened to a podcast that went through 50 ways world can be less hostile to fat people. Since it was so interesting, I made my own list on how to communicate and respect left-handed people.

1. Don't mention it:
"Oh you're a lefty" is incredibly damaging, as it triggers PTSD for centuries of falling prey to right-handed oppression.
2. If you are buttering a half slice of a loaf to give a left-handed person, remember to apply the spread to the correct side of the bread.
3. Stop trying to teach a lefty that they can write, wash their teeth, or wipe their ass with the right hand if they just practiced enough. That's incredibly patronizing and offending.
4. I am not ambidextrous, don't expect me to be able to use the knife while I am forking.
5. Don't automatically assume left-handed people are artistic or smart. We most likely aren't. And that's ableist, and offending.
6. Don't tie our left hand behind our back to "teach us to use the right hand". We had that for decades. It wasn't fun.
7. A lefty isn't the Devil's spawn. Fairy-tales have nothing to do with a person being left-handed or not... If you belong to that other religion, please feel free to dis-regard this advice.
8. Write in Arabic... Or, hell just convert to Islam and force everyone to write in Arabic. That way the world of left handed writers don't have to worry about getting their hands full of ink. Islam will do the heavy lifting in enforcing left handed writing for you.
9. Learn to handshake with your left hand.
10. Tell your lefty kid about left-handed heroes; musicians like Paul McCartney and Jimi Hendrix, actors like Whoopi Godlberg and Tom Cruise and other famous left-handers to build their confidence and self-esteem.
11. Remeber the Left Handers' Day on 8/13, don't forget it. It would be demeaning to all the left-handed people around you.
12. Left-handed people are a minority, and they are owed reparations for all the cruelty that's been done to them in the name of right-handedness.
13. Give us room when we are eating, you keep elbowing us, that's Oppression. (courtesy of [quantumworld](#comment_413_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE))
14. Left-handedness is a disability. Lefties should be eligible for social security benefits for it.
15. Disagree with any of these points and you are an ableist bigot, probably even a sexist and a racist Nazi too.

topic.title: "I would not even rape you" is not a rape threat! (rant)
topic.body:
MP Jess Philips is just salty because the UKIP candidate Carl Benjamin doesn't find her attractive.

The truth said she doesn't deserve rape. It would be too good for her.

"Benjamin 'might' rape Phillips"... Bullshit! Hence his response that there'd not be enough beer to make him do it. That's how unappealing and ugly Phillips is. She's a total erection killer. That's what he said.

topic.title: Communism – Who in their right mind would want it?
topic.body:
I've been reading a lot of discussion about socialism and communism lately.

I just can't figure out what's so great about it. I mean... We aren't all the same, we can't expect everyone to just fall in line and start donating their work and stuff for free for everyone else. We also can't expect everyone to work as hard as others.

There will always be groups and individuals who either don't care, or don't even want to participate in the group effort. Like there will always be those who want to exploit all that "free" effort.

You just can't straight out eliminate all of our differences and "inequalities". They are what make us human in the first place. We are not ants, or robots either.

What's your take on this?

1555389717_1CV23652pUmbK7yQtjyrBp7ZRhaV7.body: Retroshare (https://retroshare.cc/) is Free and Open Source.

1555302116_1FUAYb5srAuXuzNsKKtbd6cpNfQbE.body: In addition to torrents, one can also share IPFS hashes, like this: QmTYhtrc9ctnR4Yj2JC9WA8nFcFD2Pi9FsEpppaKGCRqex (Just some random Youtube video I uploaded on IPFS.)

> [adthx](#comment_3_1FUAYb5srAuXuzNsKKtbd6cpNfQbES7UBm): Can these torrents be downloaded using softwares like qbittorrent? I am somewhat new to the concept of decentralization, so..

While distributed, torrents are not necessarily very safe.

With Tribler (https://tribler.org/) though, you can easily add a step or two between you and prying eyes.

Retroshare (https://retroshare.cc/) enables you to create secure channels for media and pretty much anything between you and your friends.

There's also the Interplanetary Filesystem, IPFS (https://ipfs.io/) where you can dedicate some of your hard drive space for a global distributed and encrypted filesystem where you can fetch files with their hashes.

Anti-catholic attacks in France have shot up in recent years, and in 2019 we have already witnessed the burning of other churches-which firefighters have officially declared as arsons-the destruction of statues, altars, and the desecration of Eucharist items. For the government to call this an accident when it happened after work hours on top of a string of anti-Catholic church burnings and vandalism is ridiculous.

I much doubt that, more inclined to think this was an accident.

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_7_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): Two videos in french of the former chief architect of Notre Dame who does not understand the 'nature of the fire':    https://invidio.us/watch?v=eh8BD9K2mWY    https://invidio.us/watch?v=Ov4vSigtfaU    In filigree he explains that he does not understand how a '800-year-old wood' could have burned 'so fast like matches'.

He doesn't understand much does he? I think in 800 years, wood might become very dry, thus faster to ignite.

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_8_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): He's talking about density. An old wood is deprived from its water, thus becoming denser to burn. Like the woods that stay long in the water, the dense woods that stay long in the water, Become Like Stone.

When wood dries up, it becomes less dense as it loses matter, that's just the nature of physics.

1555665471_1BXdtJD8d5s813aPwKoxEjGWPaNGB.body:
> [dots](#comment_4_1BXdtJD8d5s813aPwKoxEjGWPaNGB8deNh): But from the perspective of the client, the leecher it's easy to use, you just have to access the file through a IPFS gateway, am I getting something wrong?

Network congestion. If you use a single point of entry (an IPFS gateway) to leech the file, and if thousands of others do the same, it will essentially be the same as making a DDOS on the gateway. Don't do it! Set up your own IPFS node instead, it's not rocket science.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_794_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Is it enough easy to use? Is there any simple M$ Windows graphical user interface to add files, manage existing, search thru them? IPFS, like Torrent, DC will cause the IP address of the sharer be visible which means copyright protective agencies can easily see which IP is violating copyright.

The difference is, they don't know what you are sharing. The graphical interface to your IPFS node is essentially your browser pointed to localhost:5001/webui

1555609581_1BXdtJD8d5s813aPwKoxEjGWPaNGB.body:
> [dots](#comment_3_1BXdtJD8d5s813aPwKoxEjGWPaNGB8deNh): Thank you both for the replies.What if I were using Brave Browser for example? Would Brave Browser have any weakness?

It has the same weaknesses as do any other browsers. You can set all the traffic to go through Tor, though.

> [suprnova](#comment_3_19vnNsGPgQ5LaGVDJRn6gZUaVFbV4c9Cbq): "From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs" --Marx

That quote... It neglects the people who either want to achieve and succeed, and those who don't even care. It also excludes criminals and sociopaths.

> "In a higher phase of communist society, after the enslaving subordination of the individual to the division of labor, and therewith also the antithesis between mental and physical labor, has vanished; after labor has become not only a means of life but life's prime want; after the productive forces have also increased with the all-around development of the individual, and all the springs of co-operative wealth flow more abundantly – only then can the narrow horizon of bourgeois right be crossed in its entirety and society inscribe on its banners: From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs!"

That's just a load of wishful thinking. Pretty words and I'd guess a noble goal. If it were possible. But alas, it isn't. Too many different people, hard to oversee and control. You'd need a complete totalitarian state to keep people working, and silence anyone who would want to express their individuality, want or need to do whatever makes themselves happy.

Seeking happiness would likely be strictly forbidden in such a state. It would be too counter-revolutionary.

> Antisocial behaviour is a genuine concern, and easily resolved really.

How? By sending people to gulags? And how would you, in a communist system differentiate any differing behavior with "anti-social" behavior?

> Marx proposed replacing money with labour certificates / vouchers that you get by working and you enter back into the system by spending them on anything, like groceries. These days, such an idea could be implemented by using a blockchain or similar technology that tracks what you 'enter' into the system by labour time and what you 'spend' by consuming.

Sounds a lot like forced servitude. Slavery. How would you preserve individual freedoms? Freedom of speech and expression? Freedom to leave the system if the system becomes too inhibitive?

> The point being is that there's affluence for anyone participating or having gained exception (like pensioners, those being sick, pregnant women, etc).

What about those who don't want to participate in the collective and want to create their own success by working for themselves, maybe become rich or famous by singing or some other shit that isn't considered "labour"?

The rest of what you wrote, about Marx and his fantasies sound pretty much something someone dreamed up high in weed. Yeah, humans aren't too bad, but don't make them do communism again. It didn't work then, and it won't work now.

> [chernobyl](#comment_5_14giYM2ws7rPBNTE8o9j8QSpkNTPXPUPiE): Who in their right mind would want it? [...]

Why would the jews want communism? Israel isn't a communist state as far as I can tell.

> [0435048ijg](#comment_1_1e6paNoDoqwCZGNa4o4uX43GrawvJuVB5): Yes. Who would possibly want freedom for themselves and everybody else? You know what sounds great? Being dominated and controlled by a small group of retards for half of your waking existence.

What on earth are you talking about? Communism is not freedom. It's is an authoritarian view that no person must do better than others, but everyone must be equally miserable.

> [0435048ijg](#comment_6_1e6paNoDoqwCZGNa4o4uX43GrawvJuVB5): I want communism

Why?
